definition: cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: I now choose to deepen my understanding of others and myself.
sentences.chinese: 我决定从现在开始加深了解别人，洞悉自己。

sentences.english: He had moments in life where insights sprang from his mind like water from a broken dam.
sentences.chinese: 有时，洞悉会像破罐力的水一样从他脑中涌出。

sentences.english: Faith is like the radar that sees through the fog-the reality of things at a distance that the human eye cannot see.
sentences.chinese: 信仰象透视迷雾的雷达，能够洞悉肉眼难辨的远景。

sentences.english: Agood command of English can give you insight into the diversity of Americanculture.
sentences.chinese: 精通英语能让你洞悉美国文化的多样性。

sentences.english: Perceive that which cannot be seen with the eye.
sentences.chinese: 洞悉不能以肉眼所见之事。

sentences.english: Mencius and Aristotle converge in their vision that human nature is essentially good.
sentences.chinese: 孟子和亚里士多德都洞悉到人类性本善。

sentences.english: BedPosted promises to give you insights into your sex life.
sentences.chinese: 网站“床上贴”承诺让你洞悉自己的性生活。

sentences.english: Demons have to be able to see in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 恶魔们即使在黑暗当中也能洞悉任何事物。

sentences.english: And forward-looking attitude, anticipating the future of the city core.
sentences.chinese: 并以前瞻姿态，洞悉未来都市生活的核心。

sentences.english: What were you afraid someone in real life might find out about you?
sentences.chinese: 那么在现实生活中，你也害怕可能有人会洞悉你吗？

definition: clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
to understand thoroughly/to see beyond the facade/to see through (sb)
see through (a person, scheme, trick etc)
to see through/disillusioned with/to reject (the world of mortals)
to find out/to ascertain/to get an idea of
one word says it all (idiom)/to hit the nail on the head/to be pithy and correct
to see through something at first glance (idiom)
to pry into or spy on/to snoop/to peep/to poke one's nose into/to peer/to get a glimpse of
